item.title: Circuit Switched vs Packet Switched Networks
item.description: By: John Shepler Over the past few decades, two primary network technologies have been vying for dominance. The first is the traditional telephone system, which served us well throughout the industrial age. The second is the computer-based architecture that has driven the information age. You might recognize these as circuit switching and packet switching. While both technologies will likely coexist for a while longer, we are at a turning point. From now on, packet switching will be the dominant force in every network, from copper lines to fiber optic cables to wireless connections.

item.title: Can You Save 50% With Unified Communications?
item.description: As your company expands, you’ve likely seen a simultaneous increase in your telephone costs. While it’s easy to assume this is simply due to having more employees making calls, the reality is that not all phone expenses are unavoidable. Unified communications technology can help you significantly reduce unnecessary costs. This approach combines your voice, data, and video networks into a single, unified system, leading to cost savings for businesses of all sizes, even those with just one location.
